Yes, it was nine o’clock. He is certain now that it was nine o’clock because he remembers having taken out his watch.

At nine o’clock, I called again. He answered.
“What do you want?” he asked.
“I was hoping to hear you say you miss me.”
“I miss you,” he said. “Is that it?”
I hung up.

Every night at nine I lay down on the smooth hardwood floor with a stretch and a yawn, and I had no trouble sleeping.
